titleStmt.title: L. Boyd et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10817

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Murray Ky Augt 29th/61
To His Excellency Beriah McGoffin
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Ky

Your Petitioners would respectfully & earnestly petition you to release M. S. Hill of a Judgment of two hundred dollars assessed against him at the August Term of the Calloway Equity & Criminal Court 1861 upon a bond for the appearance of W. M. Cook to answer whatever Indightment or Indightments that might be found against him. They state that M. S. Hill is a clever, honest, hardworking poor young man & that it will break him up to have the debt to pay, that Cook ran off & the last that has been heard of him is in North Carolina, that Hill was unable to get him.

P. M. Ellison
